intro: Androsace pavlovskii, commonly known as the Pavlovskii rock jasmine, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Primulaceae and is characterized by its dense mat-forming growth habit, with small, clustered flowers. The plant features fleshy, hairy leaves that are typically rosette-shaped, adapted to withstand harsh alpine conditions. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink, with five petals and prominent stamens, blooming in early summer. Androsace pavlovskii is often found in rocky or gravelly soils, thriving in well-drained environments.
